user is the target :)

comments.content:
Agree With you

Cisco Umbrella and Cisco Cloudlock work together to secure access to the internet and usage of cloud apps. As a cloud-delivered service, Umbrella provides the first line of defense against threats on the internet, wherever users go. It provides organizations the visibility needed to protect internet access across all network devices, office locations, and roaming users. With Umbrella, customers can stop malware infections earlier, identify already-infected devices faster and prevent data exfiltration.

Cisco Cloudlock is a Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) that helps organizations to secure their identities, data, and applications in the cloud. It provides visibility and control over global cloud activities, enabling organizations to know who is doing what in their cloud applications, protecting against compromised accounts, insider threats, and malware. Cloudlock helps organizations identify and respond to data exposures and leakages as well as privacy and compliance violations.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Cisco Umbrella 
https://security.umbrella.com/cisco-cloud-security

Selected Answer: D
Umbrella:
-Monitors DNS, web, and cloud traffic for anomalies.
-Prevents malware sending data to external domain
-Blocks risky cloud apps & unauthorized file sharing
Why not cloudlock: Great for SaaS data security, but does not monitor all data transfers (e.g., network-level or DNS-level exfiltration).
Why not Stealthwatch: Detects anomalous traffic, but focuses on network flow analysis rather than active exfiltration prevention
AppDynamics : No security and data exfiltration detection.

Selected Answer: C
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/products/collateral/security/cloudlock/cisco-cloudlock-cloud-app-security-datasheet.pdf

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/security/stealthwatch/datasheet-c78-739398.html
 Insider threat detection: Get alarmed on data hoarding, data exfiltration, and suspicious lateral movements.

https://security.umbrella.com/cisco-cloud-security
With Umbrella, customers can stop malware infections earlier, identify already-infected devices faster and prevent data exfiltration.

"Protection against data exfiltration"

Stealthwatch uses advanced machine learning and behavioral modeling techniques to establish a baseline of normal network behavior. It then identifies deviations from this baseline, helping detect suspicious data transfers and potential data exfiltration in real-time. It can also integrate with other security solutions, such as Cisco Firepower and Cisco Umbrella, to provide a more holistic security posture.

Customer situation
A company or organization’s most valuable assets include its intellectual property, confidential information, and information 
stored in its networks. Data breaches cost millions of dollars, and proper mitigation can prevent this and the loss of trust that 
can follow.

Solution:
The Cisco Stealthwatch® Exfiltration alarms track Inside Hosts and Outside Hosts to which an abnormal amount of data has 
been transferred. If a host triggers a number of these events and exceeds a configured threshold, it results in a Data 
Exfiltration alarm

PROOF2

https://cisco.bravais.com/s/15jOM9fFMK78ei07JnYK

Customer situation
As the attack landscape changes, network security becomes increasingly difficult. Cloud networks are growing in popularity, 
making it even more challenging for security teams to plan and execute security strategies. One of the key threats to 
network security is data exfiltration, which can be carried out manually by a user on the network, or by an automated 
process using a malicious program.
Solution:

Cisco Stealthwatch® has ways to detect data exfiltration attacks facing on-premise networks. For protection against data 
exfiltration in a cloud environment, Stealthwatch Cloud uses dynamic learning and entity modeling to provide similar 
detection. Stealthwatch Cloud monitors the cloud network and alerts on possible data exfiltration.

discussion.content:
B Cloudlock

All of the mentioned solutions have different features and capabilities that can help with visibility and protection against data exfiltration. However, based on the specific requirements mentioned in the question, the solution that best meets them is Cisco CloudLock.

Cisco CloudLock provides visibility and control over data in cloud applications, including data transfers and protection against data exfiltration. It offers real-time monitoring and alerting for data-related events and allows for granular policies to be applied to specific users, data types, and cloud applications. It also includes advanced threat detection capabilities, such as anomaly detection and machine learning-based analytics, to identify and mitigate potential data breaches.

Cisco CloudLock (Option B) best meets the requirements for visibility into data transfers and protection against data exfiltration.

Cisco CloudLock is a cloud-native security platform that provides visibility and control over data, users and infrastructure in the cloud. It offers a range of features including Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) and Cloud Identity and Access Management (CIAM). It can detect and prevent data exfiltration, and also provide visibility into data transfers.

While Cisco AppDynamics Cloud Monitoring (Option A) is a cloud-native monitoring solution that tracks the performance of cloud-based applications, Cisco Stealthwatch (Option C) is a network traffic analysis solution that provides visibility into network activity and detects threats, and Cisco Umbrella (Option D) is a secure internet gateway that provides protection against internet-based threats.

Selected Answer: B
B Cloudlock

Cisco Cloudlock delivers visibility and control for cloud application environments such as Microsoft Office 365, Salesforce, Google G Suite, Box, Dropbox, and others (the “Covered SaaS Environments”). It helps secure cloud identities, data, and applications.
https://trustportal.cisco.com/c/dam/r/ctp/docs/privacydatasheet/security/cisco-cloudlock-privacy-data-sheet.pdf

Selected Answer: B

questions.question_text: An engineer is trying to decide whether to use Cisco Umbrella. Cisco CloudLock. Cisco Stealthwatch. or Cisco AppDynamics Cloud Monitoring for visibility into data transfers as well as protection against data exfiltration. Which solution best meets these requirements?

discussion.content: A. Cisco Stealthwatch Cloud ( now Secure Cloud Analytics )

Selected Answer: A
A. Cisco Stealthwatch Cloud

A

questions.question_text: Which Cisco solution extends network visibility, threat detection, and analytics to public cloud environments?
When choosing an algorithm to use. what should be considered about Diffie Heilman and RSA for key establishment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is B.
RSA is not algorithm, it's cryptosystem. Meanwhile, DH is asymmetric algorithm to generate key for symmetric communication.

Selected Answer: B
Diffie Hellman uses a private-public key pair to establish a shared secret, typically a symmetric key. DH is not a symmetric algorithm – it is an asymmetric algorithm used to establish a shared secret for a symmetric key algorithm.

https://doubleoctopus.com/security-wiki/encryption-and-cryptography/diffie-hellman-algorithm/

D. 


Diffie-Hellman (DH) is a key agreement protocol that enables two parties to establish a shared secret key over an insecure communication channel. It is considered a key-establishment or key-agreement algorithm.

RSA, on the other hand, is a public-key encryption algorithm that is often used to encrypt and digitally sign data. It is considered an asymmetric algorithm, as it uses two different keys, one for encryption and one for decryption. It is not intended to output symmetric keys, but it is often used to encrypt symmetric keys and then exchange them securely

I would go for 'B':
https://crypto.stackexchange.com/questions/42180/whats-the-difference-between-rsa-and-diffie-hellman

comments.content: It is actually . Read th whole answer (RSA is an asymmetric key establishment algorithm intended to output symmetric keys.). RSA keys are ASYMMETRIC, so that is the reason why it is not D

Don't get confused by these two people. The answer is B as that is what DH is. yet D gets the asymmetric correct, these two did not read the part at the end of d that says it established symmetric keys

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
RSA is Asymetric Alg.

choices.B: DH is an asymmetric key establishment algorithm intended to output symmetric keys.
choices.D: RSA is an asymmetric key establishment algorithm intended to output symmetric keys.
choices.A: RSA is a symmetric key establishment algorithm intended to output asymmetric keys.
choices.C: DH is a symmetric key establishment algorithm intended to output asymmetric keys.
